title: Vertex AI - Set up for Vertex AI Experiments
abstract:
# Vertex AI - Set up for Vertex AI Experiments
Vertex AI Experiments is supported by the Vertex AI SDK for Python and Google Cloud console. Vertex AI Experiments requires and depends on [Vertex ML Metadata](/vertex-ai/docs/ml-metadata/introduction) .
content:
## Set up
- Create a Service account. See [Create a service account with required permissions](/vertex-ai/docs/experiments/tensorboard-training#create_a_service_account_with_required_permissions) .
- Install the [Vertex AI SDK for Python.](/vertex-ai/docs/start/install-sdk) 
- Check for existence of the`default`Metadata Store  in your project. (required)- To see if your project has the`default`Metadata Store,   go to the`Metadata`page in the Google Cloud console.
- If the`default`Metadata Store doesn't exist, it's   created when- you run the first,
- or, create your first experiment in the Vertex AI SDK for Python.Optional: To configure with CMEK, see [Configure your project's metadata store.](/vertex-ai/docs/ml-metadata/configure) ## Supported Locations
The [Feature availability](/vertex-ai/docs/general/locations#americas_1) table lists the available locations for Vertex AI Experiments. When using Vertex AI Pipelines or Vertex AI TensorBoard, they must be in the same location as your Vertex AI experiment.
## What's next
- [Create an experiment](/vertex-ai/docs/experiments/create-experiment) ## Relevant notebook tutorials
- [Compare trained and evaluated models](/vertex-ai/docs/experiments/user-journey/uj-compare-models) 
- [Model training with prebuilt data pre-processing code](/vertex-ai/docs/experiments/user-journey/uj-model-training) 
- [Compare pipeline runs](/vertex-ai/docs/experiments/user-journey/uj-compare-pipeline-runs) 
- [Autologging](/vertex-ai/docs/experiments/user-journey/uj-autologging)
